PLCS announces optional remote learning plan for all students: https://bit.ly/2CKIHAF.

We want you to know that based on feedback from many parents and our Board of Education, we have decided to offer a remote learning program option for all families. We believe it is important for our families to have choices. We are still committed to offering the in person, face to face program for all students. We know the best learning happens in the classroom with the classroom teacher, teaching students. However, if parents are genuinely concerned about the wellbeing of their children or have a medical condition that causes them concern, we want families to have a choice. #GreatnessHappensTogether #PLCSGreat #PLCSBeKnown

PLCS Staff is PLCS Great: Elizabeth Lyle, a fifth-grade teacher at Prairie Queen Elementary, is nominated for having great relationships with her students. A parent nominated her saying, "Ms. Lyle goes above and beyond in a regular classroom setting, but her dedication to her profession and her students has never been more clear since the school closure." The parent said her daughter was concerned about not seeing her teacher again once school shifted to remote learning. The parent reached out to Ms. Lyle about the issue and within minutes she replied to have her daughter help her test a zoom call. "Seeing my daughter after that zoom call spoke volumes to me about the connection she has with Ms. Lyle. Just being able to see her and talk to her eased her anxiety and gave her the strength she needed to continue moving forward," the parent said. This parent is forever grateful to Ms. Lyle for taking time to maintain her connection with her students through phone calls and mail.

Elizabeth Lyle is #PLCSGreat!
